verses.verse: My son, <WH1121> keep <WH8104> my words, <WH561> and lay <WH6845> up my commandments <WH4687> with you.
Keep <WH8104> my commandments, <WH4687> and live; <WH2421> and my law <WH8451> as the apple <WH380> of your eye. <WH5869>
Bind <WH7194> them on your fingers, <WH676> write <WH3789> them on the table <WH3871> of your heart. <WH3820>
Say <WH559> to wisdom, <WH2451> You are my sister; <WH269> and call <WH7121> understanding <WH998> your kinswoman: <WH4129>
That they may keep <WH8104> you from the strange <WH2114> woman, <WH802> from the stranger <WH5237> which flatters <WH2505> with her words. <WH561>
For at the window <WH2474> of my house <WH1004> I looked <WH8259> through my casement, <WH822>
And beheld <WH7200> among the simple <WH6612> ones, I discerned <WH995> among the youths, <WH1121> a young <WH5288> man void <WH2638> of understanding, <WH3820>
Passing <WH5674> through the street <WH7784> near <WH681> her corner; <WH6438> and he went <WH6805> the way <WH1870> to her house, <WH1004>
In the twilight, <WH5399> in the evening, <WH6153> in the black <WH380> and dark <WH653> night: <WH3915>
And, behold, <WH2009> there met <WH7125> him a woman <WH802> with the attire <WH7897> of an harlot, <WH2181> and subtle <WH5341> of heart. <WH3820>
(She is loud <WH1993> and stubborn; <WH5637> her feet <WH7272> abide <WH7931> not in her house: <WH1004>
Now <WH6471> is she without, <WH2351> now <WH6471> in the streets, <WH7339> and lies in wait <WH693> at <WH681> every <WH3605> corner. <WH6438>)
So she caught <WH2388> him, and kissed <WH5401> him, and with an impudent <WH5810> face <WH6440> said <WH559> to him,
I have peace <WH8002> offerings with me; this day <WH3117> have I paid <WH7999> my vows. <WH5088>
Therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> came <WH3318> I forth <WH3318> to meet <WH7125> you, diligently <WH7836> to seek <WH7836> your face, <WH6440> and I have found <WH4672> you.
I have decked <WH7234> my bed <WH6210> with coverings <WH4765> of tapestry, with carved <WH2405> works, with fine linen <WH948> of Egypt. <WH4714>
I have perfumed <WH5130> my bed <WH4904> with myrrh, <WH4753> aloes, <WH174> and cinnamon. <WH7076>
Come, <WH3212> let us take our fill <WH7301> of love <WH1730> until <WH5704> the morning: <WH1242> let us solace <WH5965> ourselves with loves. <WH159>
For the manager <WH376> is not at home, <WH1004> he is gone <WH1980> a long <WH7350> journey: <WH1870>
He has taken <WH3947> a bag <WH6872> of money <WH3701> with him, and will come <WH935> home <WH1004> at the day <WH3117> appointed. <WH3677>
With her much <WH7230> fair <WH3948> speech <WH3948> she caused him to yield, <WH5186> with the flattering <WH2506> of her lips <WH8193> she forced <WH5080> him.
He goes <WH1980> after <WH310> her straightway, <WH6597> as an ox <WH7794> goes <WH935> to the slaughter, <WH2874> or as a fool <WH191> to the correction <WH4148> of the stocks; <WH5914>
Till <WH5704> a dart <WH2671> strike <WH6398> through his liver; <WH3516> as a bird <WH6833> hastens <WH4116> to the snare, <WH6341> and knows <WH3045> not that it is for his life. <WH5315>
Listen <WH8085> to me now <WH6258> therefore, O you children, <WH1121> and attend <WH7181> to the words <WH561> of my mouth. <WH6310>
Let not your heart <WH3820> decline <WH7847> to her ways, <WH1870> go <WH8582> not astray <WH8582> in her paths. <WH5410>
For she has cast <WH5307> down many <WH7227> wounded: <WH2491> yes, many <WH3605> strong <WH6099> men have been slain <WH2026> by her.
Her house <WH1004> is the way <WH1870> to hell, <WH7585> going <WH3381> down <WH3381> to the chambers <WH2315> of death. <WH4194>
